5105.verse: قَدْ|Indeed,|70|79|1097$سَمِعَ ٱللَّهُ|Allah has heard|121|140|3551$قَوْلَ|(the) speech|106|125|3552$ٱلَّتِى|(of) one who|106|125|232$تُجَـٰدِلُكَ|disputes with you|137|156|16695$فِى|concerning|92|101|89$زَوْجِهَا|her husband|101|116|16696$وَتَشْتَكِىٓ|and she directs her complaint|216|245|16697$إِلَى|to|53|82|118$ٱللَّهِ|Allah.|56|85|606$وَٱللَّهُ|And Allah|81|110|167$يَسْمَعُ|hears|72|87|11200$تَحَاوُرَكُمَآ‌ۚ|(the) dialogue of both of you.|218|236|16698$إِنَّ|Indeed,|70|107|58$ٱللَّهَ|Allah|53|90|184$سَمِيعُۢ|(is) All-Hearer,|117|154|1573$بَصِيرٌ|All-Seer.|79|98|911$

5106.verse: ٱلَّذِينَ|Those who|92|103|20$يُظَـٰهِرُونَ|pronounce zihar|125|147|16699$مِنكُم|among you|92|114|643$مِّن|[from]|61|83|53$نِّسَآئِهِم|(to) their wives,|128|150|1976$مَّا|not|42|64|262$هُنَّ|they|51|62|1628$أُمَّهَـٰتِهِمْ‌ۖ|(are) their mothers.|151|161|16700$إِنْ|Not|44|64|225$أُمَّهَـٰتُهُمْ|(are) their mothers|146|166|13927$إِلَّا|except|65|85|86$ٱلَّــٰٓــِٔى|those who|89|109|13916$وَلَدْنَهُمْ‌ۚ|gave them birth.|130|140|16701$وَإِنَّهُمْ|And indeed, they|133|141|5517$لَيَقُولُونَ|surely say|95|111|14731$مُنكَرًا|an evil|80|96|16702$مِّنَ|[of]|50|66|156$ٱلْقَوْلِ|[the] word|91|107|4429$وَزُورًا‌ۚ|and a lie.|87|103|12704$وَإِنَّ|But indeed,|95|103|713$ٱللَّهَ|Allah|53|135|184$لَعَفُوٌّ|(is) surely, Oft-Pardoning,|193|356|12163$غَفُورٌ|Oft-Forgiving.|112|194|1499$

5107.verse: وَٱلَّذِينَ|And those who|119|125|42$يُظَـٰهِرُونَ|pronounce zihar|125|138|16699$مِن|[from]|61|74|53$نِّسَآئِهِمْ|(to) their wives|123|136|1976$ثُمَّ|then|50|63|293$يَعُودُونَ|go back|97|110|16703$لِمَا|on what|74|80|426$قَالُواْ|they said,|86|98|101$فَتَحْرِيرُ|then freeing|100|123|4312$رَقَبَةٍ|(of) a slave|97|120|5212$مِّن قَبْلِ|before|92|115|2115$أَن|[that]|60|83|655$يَتَمَآسَّا‌ۚ|they touch each other.|175|186|16704$ذَٲلِكُمْ|That|69|90|488$تُوعَظُونَ|you are admonished|152|193|16705$بِهِۦ‌ۚ|to it.|53|94|204$وَٱللَّهُ|And Allah|81|122|167$بِمَا|of what|71|112|43$تَعْمَلُونَ|you do|92|113|725$خَبِيرٌ|(is) All-Aware.|115|115|2091$

5108.verse: فَمَن|Then whoever|114|126|402$لَّمْ|(does) not|90|114|63$يَجِدْ|find,|56|80|1735$فَصِيَامُ|then fasting|100|124|1736$شَهْرَيْنِ|(for) two months|133|157|4320$مُتَتَابِعَيْنِ|consecutively|111|123|4321$مِن قَبْلِ|before|92|105|2115$أَن|[that]|60|86|655$يَتَمَآسَّا‌ۖ|they both touch each other.|210|236|16704$فَمَن|But (he) who|107|133|402$لَّمْ|not|42|68|63$يَسْتَطِعْ|is able|86|99|16706$فَإِطْعَامُ|then (the) feeding|142|150|16707$سِتِّينَ|(of) sixty|81|97|16708$مِسْكِينًا‌ۚ|needy one(s).|113|129|16709$ذَٲلِكَ|That -|64|80|28$لِتُؤْمِنُواْ|so that you may believe|180|196|15865$بِٱللَّهِ|in Allah|67|75|79$وَرَسُولِهِۦ‌ۚ|and His Messenger,|148|162|2497$وَتِلْكَ|and these|86|114|2028$حُدُودُ|(are the) limits|118|146|3788$ٱللَّهِ‌ۗ|(of) Allah,|86|114|606$وَلِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ|and for the disbelievers|175|189|871$عَذَابٌ|(is) a punishment|135|376|72$أَلِيمٌ|painful.|68|309|93$

5109.verse: إِنَّ|Indeed,|70|77|58$ٱلَّذِينَ|those who|89|103|20$يُحَآدُّونَ|oppose|94|108|16710$ٱللَّهَ|Allah|53|67|184$وَرَسُولَهُۥ|and His Messenger|143|157|3790$كُبِتُواْ|(will) be disgraced|141|155|16711$كَمَا|as|53|60|110$كُبِتَ|were disgraced|120|129|16712$ٱلَّذِينَ|those|70|88|20$مِن قَبْلِهِمْ‌ۚ|before them.|107|125|1094$وَقَدْ|And certainly|107|125|2117$أَنزَلْنَآ|We have sent down|152|170|929$ءَايَـٰتِۭ|Verses|78|87|930$بَيِّنَـٰتٍ‌ۚ|clear.|74|108|931$وَلِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ|And for the disbelievers|176|245|871$عَذَابٌ|(is) a punishment|135|204|72$مُّهِينٌ|humiliating.|94|128|872$

5110.verse: يَوْمَ|(On the) Day|107|113|1057$يَبْعَثُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ|(when) Allah will raise them|202|214|5557$جَمِيعًا|all|78|90|300$فَيُنَبِّئُهُم|and inform them|127|139|5932$بِمَا|of what|71|83|43$عَمِلُوٓاْ‌ۚ|they did.|79|85|6052$أَحْصَـٰهُ ٱللَّهُ|Allah has recorded it|156|170|16713$وَنَسُوهُ‌ۚ|while they forgot it.|152|180|16714$وَٱللَّهُ|And Allah|81|109|167$عَلَىٰ|(is) over|76|104|52$كُلِّ|all|49|77|185$شَىْءٍ|things|69|83|186$شَهِيدٌ|a Witness.|90|90|2562$

5105.verse: Certainly has Allah heard the speech of the one who argues with you, [O Muhammad], concerning her husband and directs her complaint to Allah. And Allah hears your dialogue; indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

5106.verse: Those who pronounce thihar among you [to separate] from their wives - they are not [consequently] their mothers. Their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. And indeed, they are saying an objectionable statement and a falsehood. But indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.

5107.verse: And those who pronounce thihar from their wives and then [wish to] go back on what they said - then [there must be] the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. That is what you are admonished thereby; and Allah is Acquainted with what you do.

5108.verse: And he who does not find [a slave] - then a fast for two months consecutively before they touch one another; and he who is unable - then the feeding of sixty poor persons. That is for you to believe [completely] in Allah and His Messenger; and those are the limits [set by] Allah. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.

5109.verse: Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger are abased as those before them were abased. And We have certainly sent down verses of clear evidence. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.

5110.verse: On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all and inform them of what they did. Allah had enumerated it, while they forgot it; and Allah is, over all things, Witness.
